page.title: 12St Peters Church.
page.content: Generally the rectors of St. Peters have been law abiding clergymen but there was a certain Thomas Bole of Tempsford who during the reign of Henry 6th was outlawed for treason. Another rector of the parish a Giles King who after the civil war refused to accept the new order disappeared into obscurity. During the civil war Bedfordshire was only lukewarm to the Kings cause, and only one Charles Upton of Tempsford declared his sympathy for the king but he never went to war. Once the very keystone of people's lives St.Peters like many other village churches suffers a dwinderling congregation.
